results.title: Study Patterns Pt.1 (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Study Patterns”.
Encourages students to think about and improve their methods of study. Skills discussed are basic skills; reading skills; writing skills; listening skills; participation skills; examination skills and practical skills.

results.title: Study Method
results.brief_description: This “How to Study” guide explores in detail problems students have in studying. Study techniques and their application are examined from both the Educational and Psychological aspects. Includes: effective reading, note taking and study organisation, setting targets and handling anxiety and stress (includes demonstration of relaxation techniques).

results.title: Study is not a dirty word
results.brief_description: Shows how to develop effective study techniques. Covers efficient notetaking; improved memory of new information through better listening, reading and notes; the necessity to relate all information to a central idea; and the motivation to do it. No other credits available.

results.title: Study in steel
results.creator_credit: Topical Press Agency and Commercial and Educational Films
results.brief_description: The building of a locomotive of the “Princess Royal” class. Describes the many parts which go to make up this type of locomotive.

results.title: Students in Berlin
results.brief_description: Shows the Free University of West Berlin and students from all over the world in part-time jobs in the city and at their studies. The history of the Free University, from its establishment by the students themselves to its present prosperous condition, with many fine buildings, numerous research institutes and large self-governing student body.

results.title: Student participation
results.creator_credit: Neville Stanley, Jeff Spencer, Victoria. Ministry of Education and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
A look at various aspects of student participation in a number of different primary schools in Victoria. Covers curriculum decision-making in the classroom, students running school assemblies, writing school rules and regional meetings of school leaders.

results.title: Student participation
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A program that discusses and illustrates student participation which is seen as part of the broader decision-making partnership among teachers, students, parents, principals and administrators from school to state level.
